did.unittitle: Summer Evangelistic Committee of Philadelphia Presbytery records

bioghist.p: The Summer Evangelistic Committee (SEC) was organized in 1899 by the Presbytery of Philadelphia and the Presbyterian Social Union to " present the Gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ throughout the metropolitan area of Philadelphia each year during the months of June to September." Members of the Summer Evangelistic Committee represented the PCUSA Presbytery of Philadelphia, the PCUSA Presbytery of Philadelphia North, and the Presbyterian Social Union.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Summer Evangelistic Committee. Materials include: seven volumes of minutes, 1900-1924 (4 volumes) and minutes from 1969-1970, 1972-1974, and 1983-1985; printed annual reports, 1917-1988 (incomplete); and brochures, early 2000s. Minutes include reports from committees, treasurer's reports, occasional annual reports, lists of committee members and attendance records. Committees include Open Air, Equipment, Wayside Mission, Industrial Area, Radio and TV, Children's Work, and Tents and Places of Worship. Volumes 1 and 2 include copies of the Committee's constitution and by-laws. The collection also includes photographs, probably made and exhibited for the 50th Anniversary of the SEC in 1949, although the photographs may have been made much later.
